content: Is anyone interested in chatting about session submissions for Drupal Camp Florida tonight?
Deadline is tonight. I will try to submit something.
Stupid pandemic. I miss visiting the Drupal Florida guys.
That is about the most annoying registration I've seen in a long time. I could just put in my Twitter handle... nope has to be the full URL. Same with the Drupal profile.
@John Franklin - Maybe I'll see you IN Florida next year.
I've been to two Florida Drupal camps. It's a good camp.

https://www.fldrupal.camp/sessions/sessions-drupal-island/backdrop-cms-and-drupal-89-whats-same-whats-different

Backdrop CMS and Drupal 8/9 - What's the Same & What's Different
Backdrop CMS has undergone 18 feature releases sinces forking Drupal 7 a little over 6 years ago. With each new release, the project drifts slightly away from Drupal, yet so much of Backdrop will remain familiar to Drupal 7 users and developers. In this session we'll talk about the things that make Backdrop unique and different as well as how it compares to Drupal 8/9. In particular we'll look at some of the major innovations in Drupal 8/9 compare to Backdrop CMS, things like Layouts and Configuration Management. We'll also talk about how the Backdrop CMS community and decision making process compares to the Drupal project.

https://www.fldrupal.camp/sessions/design-theming-front-end-development/adapting-drupal-7-theme-backdrop-cms

Adapting a Drupal 7 theme for Backdrop CMS
Now that Drupal 7 is reaching it's end of life, you may be evaluating potential options for your site's future. Upgrading to Backdrop CMS will be the easiest move to make -- but is it the right fit for you and your team?
